cyclone.name: CINDY
cyclone.current_location: about 280 miles south of Morgan City, Louisiana

motion.speed: 0 mph (will increase to ~10 mph NW tonight)

cyclone.trajectory: Forecast to move northwest toward the southwest Louisiana–upper Texas coast, then turn north over Louisiana and Arkansas and weaken inland toward the lower Ohio Valley by day-4/5.
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: southwest Louisiana / southeast Texas coast (near the Texas-Louisiana state line)
cyclone.hours_to_offshore: N/A (system remains inland well west of Virginia)

weather_observation.watch_coast: Tropical Storm Watch/Warning only in effect along the northern Gulf Coast — San Luis Pass, TX eastward to the Mouth of the Pearl River
weather_observation.warning_coast: Same as watch area: San Luis Pass, TX to Mouth of Pearl River, LA (Tropical Storm Warning)
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Northern Gulf Coast from central Texas to the western Florida Panhandle
weather_observation.closest_wind_data_location: None listed (no Mid-Atlantic sites in probability table)
weather_observation.rain_fall_above_4_inch: Unlikely – current guidance suggests <3 inches for VA
weather_observation.wind: Breezy conditions possible (generally <30 mph) as remnants pass west of the state
weather_observation.storm_surge: None expected along the Virginia coast
weather_observation.rainfall: Potential for periods of moderate to locally heavy rain as remnants pass inland late Sat–Sun
weather_observation.other_hazards: Localized inland flooding of poor-drainage areas if bands move over the Tidewater region
